question: During the third stage of the demographic transition model, which of the following is true?
subject: high_school_geography
choices: Birth rates increase and population growth rate is less rapid.
Birth rates decline and population growth rate is less rapid.
Birth rates increase and population growth rate increases.
Birth rates decrease and population growth rate increases.

topic.name: demographic transition
topic.description: In demography, demographic transition is a phenomenon and theory which refers to the historical shift from high birth rates and high death rates in societies with minimal technology, education (especially of women) and economic development, to low birth rates and low death rates in societies with advanced technology, education and economic development, as well as the stages between these two scenarios.

entities.name: demographic transition
entities.description: In demography, demographic transition is a phenomenon and theory which refers to the historical shift from high birth rates and high death rates in societies with minimal technology, education (especially of women) and economic development, to low birth rates and low death rates in societies with advanced technology, education and economic development, as well as the stages between these two scenarios.

entities.name: third stage of demographic transition
entities.description: In stage three of demographic transition, birth rates fall due to various fertility factors such as access to contraception, increases in wages, urbanization, a reduction in subsistence agriculture, an increase in the status and education of women, a reduction in the value of children's work, an increase in parental investment in the education of children and other social changes.

entities.name: birth rates
entities.description: Birth rate, also known as natality, is the total number of live human births per 1,000 population for a given period divided by the length of the period in years.

entities.name: population growth rate
entities.description: Population growth is the increase in the number of people in a population or dispersed group. Actual global human population growth amounts to around 83 million annually, or 1.1% per year.

question: Which of the following is expected to be a polar molecule?
subject: high_school_chemistry

topic.name: molecular polarity
topic.description: In chemistry, polarity is a separation of electric charge leading to a molecule or its chemical groups having an electric dipole moment, with a negatively charged end and a positively charged end.

entities.name: molecular polarity
entities.description: In chemistry, polarity is a separation of electric charge leading to a molecule or its chemical groups having an electric dipole moment, with a negatively charged end and a positively charged end.

entities.name: PCl4F
entities.description: This is a molecule composed of phosphorus, chlorine, and fluorine.

entities.name: BF3
entities.description: This is a molecule made up of boron and fluorine.

entities.name: CO2
entities.description: This is carbon dioxide, composed of carbon and oxygen.

entities.name: Si(CH3)4
entities.description: This is tetramethylsilane, consisting of silicon and methyl groups (CH3).

entities.description: The United States of America (USA), commonly known as the United States (U.S.) or America, is a country primarily located in North America.

entities.description: Indonesia,officially the Republic of Indonesia, is a country in Southeast Asia and Oceania between the Indian and Pacific oceans.

entities.name: Pakistan
entities.description: Pakistan,[e] officially the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, is a country in South Asia. It is the fifth-most populous country, with a population of over 241.5 million, having the largest Muslim population as of 2023.
